intro: Neuropeltis occidentalis, commonly known as the western neuropeltis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include a woody stem, palmately divided leaves, and white to pale yellow flowers. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique growth habit.
